description: This Kotlin source file defines a singleton object ApiClient that provides network configuration and HTTP client setup for the application. It includes methods for constructing Retrofit instances, configuring OkHttp clients with interceptors, and managing base URLs extracted from BuildConfig. The file also defines a nested data class NetworkConfig for holding service URLs and utility functions for handling URL validation and string manipulation.

classes.name: ApiClient
classes.description: Singleton object providing network configuration, HTTP client setup, and Retrofit instance creation for network communication.

classes.name: ApiClient.NetworkConfig
classes.description: Data class holding base URLs for different services, with methods to build from BuildConfig and check for missing or placeholder URLs.

methods.name: ApiClient.NetworkConfig.fromBuildConfig
methods.description: Constructs a NetworkConfig instance by reading URL strings from BuildConfig fields or default placeholders.

methods.name: ApiClient.NetworkConfig.safeBuildConfigString
methods.description: Safely retrieves a string value from BuildConfig class fields, returning null if not found or empty.

methods.name: ApiClient.NetworkConfig.isMissingOrPlaceholder
methods.description: Checks if any of the base URLs are blank or contain the placeholder string, indicating incomplete configuration.

methods.description: Creates and returns a Retrofit instance configured with the provided base URL, OkHttp client, and Gson converter.
